paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Age range: 30-70 years; 70% male; predominantly Caucasian

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with cardiomyopathy at age 32.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with peripheral neuropathy at age 58.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 50.

functional_data.summary: In vitro studies showed altered protein stability and aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of TTR amyloidosis.
variants.population_frequency: Rare in general population; specific frequency not reported.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family studies and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is the most common variant associated with familial amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The genetic mutations causing TTR amyloidosis vary among ethnicities with the most common V30M mutation having clusters in Portugal, Japan and Sweden.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
